titleInfo.title: Photograph of Olivia Adams and Young Adams, 1920s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Copy of a black and white photograph of two people sitting in front of a backdrop. Mrs. Olivia Adams holds a kerchief in her hand and there is a decorative wreath at her feet. Beside her sits Mr. Young Adams with one leg crossed over the other. Mrs. Olivia Adams is the aunt-in-law of Mrs. Mary Mitchell. Mr. Young Adams is the great paternal grandfather of Mrs. Mary Mitchell. Mrs. Olivia Adams lived in Chicago and she worked in an ammunition factory during World War I. She was a fan of golfing. Mr. Young Adams may have died in Collierville, Tennessee. Mr. Young Adams was referred to as Big Poppa.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
